events.title: Publication of the First Issue of Encyclopédie
events.description: The first volume of the Encyclopédie, edited by Denis Diderot and Jean le Rond d'Alembert, was published in France.
events.significance: This work was a landmark in the Enlightenment, aiming to gather and disseminate knowledge widely and promote intellectual interchange.

events.title: United States Military Academy Established
events.description: President Thomas Jefferson signed the act establishing the United States Military Academy at West Point, New York.
events.significance: West Point became the premier institution for training U.S. Army officers and has played a crucial role in shaping American military leadership.

events.title: My Lai Massacre Occurs in Vietnam
events.description: American soldiers killed hundreds of unarmed Vietnamese civilians in the village of My Lai during the Vietnam War.
events.significance: The massacre became a symbol of the war's brutality and significantly influenced U.S. public opinion against the Vietnam War.

events.title: Robert Goddard Launches the First Liquid-Fueled Rocket
events.description: American physicist Robert H. Goddard successfully launched the world's first liquid-fueled rocket in Auburn, Massachusetts.
events.significance: This event marked a significant milestone in rocket technology and the beginning of modern rocketry.
